Hey Devs, Could you consider improving the fuel transfer system? Thanks!

...

...

...

Oh you want to know how you can do that? Here is an easy way you can do that: Multi-tank Transfers

Lets say that you have tanks X, Y, and Z.

You want to fill you center tank of your rocket(Y) from your two side tanks(X and Z) with manual transfer because you forgot to add fuel lines You cannot do this currently and have balanced tanks in the current version. But with this improvement, clicking "in" on tank Y while you have your other 2 tanks "alt(or mod, as the KSP wiki calls it) clicked" will take equal percentages (or amount, you devs can decide because of the fact that larger tanks drain more fuel, faster) from X and Z and put them into Y.

Thanks for the consideration of this idea, and good luck developing the game everyone is watching!! (no pressure )
You don't like TacFuelBalancer ? And theres more Mods to do it. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25823-0-24-2-TAC-Fuel-Balancer-v2-4-17Aug
I think that stock really should have better fuel transfer system, but it shouldn't be able to be exploited to replace fuel lines.
Maxmaps was mentioning intent to improve the fuel transfer system some time ago so there's good chance we'll get it soon.

I think that stock really should have better fuel transfer system, but it shouldn't be able to be exploited to replace fuel lines.

That's a tough balance to strike, any sufficiently quick and easy transfer system can substitute for fuel lines in most situations.
Requirement on zero thrust to transfer fuel could be enough.

Requirement on zero thrust to transfer fuel could be enough.

That's a simple way to keep fuel lines relevant, I hadn't thought of that. Though it would make balancing fuel in spaceplanes a bit of a chore.

Perhaps you could require the zero thrust for multi-tank transfers only and leave the current transfer ability as is. In other words, only allow the transfer menu to show when selecting the 3rd or higher tanks if thrust is zeroed out.

That's a simple way to keep fuel lines relevant, I hadn't thought of that. Though it would make balancing fuel in spaceplanes a bit of a chore.

I think the suggestion may have been:

Thrust off, transfer from any tank to any tank.

Thrust on, only able to transfer between tanks connected by crossfeed or fuel lines.

Works for me.
